verse.name: v1
verse.lines: The King shall come when morning dawns and light triumphant breaks, when beauty gilds the eastern hills, and life to joy awakes.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Not as of old a little child to bear, and fight, and die, but crowned with glory like the sun that lights the morning sky.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: O brighter than the rising morn when He, victorious, rose and left the lonesome place of death, despite the rage of foes.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: O brighter than that glorious morn shall this fair morning be, when Christ, our King, in beauty comes, and we His face shall see.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: The King shall come when morning dawns, and earth's dark night is past: O haste the rising of that morn, the day that aye shall last.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: And let the endless bliss begin, by weary saints foretold, when right shall triumph over wrong, and truth shall be extolled.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: The King shall come when morning dawns, and light and beauty brings; "Hail, Christ the Lord!" Thy people pray, come quickly, King of kings!
